alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Colerain Township, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Mason, Norwood, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming, Mount Healthy, Deer Park, Finneytown, West Chester and Ross. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 5 and 20. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 16, and near mile marker 18. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 5 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
